Dry and clear overnight into Thursday. Low of -2.5C on Thursday morning, and high of +3C. Overnight low of -2C again on Thurs eve, then some cloud cover from 9pm, with temps of 0C all night. 1mm rain on Friday morning.

data.weather: Light rain on Monday morning, then dry and clear on Tuesday, & Wednesday, also strong winds on Weds. Dry, overcast & breezy on Thurs. Dry and overcast on Friday, with strong winds, max temp 5C. Slight frost o'night of -1.5C, but temps currently +2C and cloudy. Cloud set to disperse and sunny afternoon forecast, max temp 4C.
data.other: Fence No 9. (last fence down the back) will be bypassed throughout the meeting - ground under repair. Take offs, landings and other vulnerable areas covered Thurs. Going Enquiries: Jonjo Sanderson - 07831 437453 Ian Ward - 07880 722586
data.rail: Both bends will be run as shared bends, as they were on 6th Jan. The 'A1' bend is now 21yds out from its 'official' inside line. The 'Away' Chase bend is now 18yds out from its 'official' inside line, meaning that theoretically the 'Away' hurdle bend is located 6yds less than its official inside line. Race distances are affected as follows: Races 1 & 5: +108yds Races 2 & 6: +180yds Races 3 & 7: +45yds Race 4: +117yds

data.going: Racing on 15th Jan abandoned at 13.00 hrs on 14th Jan (GoingStick: N/A on Saturday at 13:00)
data.weather: -1 degrees Fri night and at 13.00 hrs on Sat inspection we would not have raced today because frost still in the ground. Forecast: Sat night -1 degrees, clear night. Then 70-80% chance of snow Sun morning between 7 and 10 am giving 2-4 cms then possible rain. Max temp +3 degrees tomorrow.
data.other: Sorry to all for abandoning the fixture but we would not have been able to race yesterday because of snow and today because of frost and tomorrow we would be battling both those elements. Any questions please call me on 07767 802206. David

data.weather: Damp at beginning of last week. Dry & overcast on Thursday. Dry & bright on Friday. Mostly dry on Saturday, but slight drizzle in the afternoon. Cold overnight into Sunday, with slight frost. Overcast on Sunday (3c). Clear night into Monday morning (low of -3C briefly) & light frost. +4C at noon and clouding over. -3C AT ITS LOWEST SINCE DAYBREAK. TEMPS NOW EXPECTED TO GET TO +4C BY NOON AND THEN +6C BY 2PM, GENERALLY CLOUDY, WITH SUNNY SPELLS.
data.other: Going Enquiries: Jonjo Sanderson - 07831 437453 Ian Ward - 07880 722586
data.rail: Rail aligned as per last Meeting. 'A1' bend 21yds from innermost line. 'Away' Chase bend 18yds from innermost line, 'Away' Hurdle bend 6yds less than 'official' innermost line. data.going: Good, good to soft in places (frozen in places) Race meeting abandoned 2pm Wed 25th Jan.
data.weather: Current day temp on Wed +2 with fog. Forecast: Wed night foggy with -1 to -2 degrees to start, then cloud clears and temp dips to -3 to -4. Thurs, +3 degrees max with a very cold southerly wind giving a chill factor of about -2 degrees.
data.other: Fakenham has now had 4 nights of sub zero temps (-4 to -8 degrees) and frost has got into the ground and it is unsafe to race on. The forecast for the next 24 hrs gives no indication of temperatures or conditions improving, in fact it is forecast to get worse with another cold sub zero night and a colder day on Thursday. Any questions please give me a call on 07767 802206, David.
